verses.verse: Before the Festival of the Passover, after Jesus realized that His hour had come so that He might step from this world to the Father, He, who loved His own people (the people in the world), loved them to the conclusion.
And after dinner happened, when the Accuser had already put in the heart of Judas, a son of Simon, an Iscariot, that he would turn Him in,
Jesus realizing that the Father has given everything to Him, into His hands, and that He came out from God and is going back to God,
He gets up from the dinner, puts His clothes down, and after taking a linen towel, tied it across Himself.
After that He puts water into the large bowl and began to be washing the feet of the students and to be wiping them dry with the linen towel that had been tied across.
So He comes to Simon Peter. And that Peter says to Him, "Master, are You washing my feet?"
Jesus answered and said to him, "What I am doing, you don't realize now. You will know after these things."
Peter says to Him, "You will not in any way wash my feet for the span of time." Jesus answered him, "If I will not wash you, you have no part with Me."
Simon Peter says to Him, "Master, not just my feet, but also the hands and the head."
Jesus says to him, "The person who has been given a bath has no need than to wash the feet, but the whole body is clean. And you are clean, but definitely not all."
You see, He knew the person turning Him in. Because of this, He said, "You are definitely not all clean."
So when He washed their feet and took His clothes, after settling down again, He said to them, "Do you know what I have done to you?
You holler at Me, 'the Teacher' and 'the Master', and nicely you say it. You see, that is what I am.
So if I, the Master and the Teacher, washed your feet, you are obligated to also be washing the feet of each other.
You see, I gave you a demonstration so that, just as I did to you, you also may do.
Amen, amen, I tell you, a slave is not greater than his master, neither a missionary greater than the one who sent him.
If you realize these things, you are blessed if you do them.

I am not talking about all of you. I realize whom I selected, but I selected him so that the Old Testament writing (in Psalm 41:9) might be accomplished, 'The one chewing the bread with me raised up his heel on Me.'
From now on I am telling you before the time for it to happen so that you might trust (when it happens) that I am Him.
Amen, amen, I tell you, the person receiving whomever I sent receives Me. The person receiving Me receives the One who sent Me."
After Jesus said these things, He was uneasy in the spirit. And He told what He witnessed and said, "Amen, amen, I tell you that one from among you will turn Me in."
So the students were looking at each other, not sure what to think about what He says.
One of His students was reclining in the front of Jesus (whom Jesus kept loving).
So Simon Peter gestures to this person to inquire who it might be that He is talking about.
When that person got down on the chest of Jesus, he says to Him, "Master, who is it?"
Jesus answers, "It is that person to whom, after dipping the fragment of bread, I will give it over to." And after dipping the fragment, He gives it to Judas, the son of Simon, an Iscariot.
And after the fragment of bread, at that time, the Opponent went into that man. So Jesus says to him, "Do what you are doing faster."
None of the people reclining knew why He said this to him.
You see, it seemed to some, since Judas had the money box, that Jesus says to him, "Buy what things we have a need of for the festival" or that he should give something to the poor.
So after that man took the fragment, he went out right away. It was night.
So when he went out, Jesus says, "Now the Son of the Person was made magnificent, and God was made magnificent in Him.
If God was made magnificent in Him, God will also make Him magnificent in Himself, and right away He will make Him magnificent.
Little children, for yet a little while I am with you. You will look for Me, and just as I said to the Jewish people ('Where I am going back to, you are not able to come'), I also tell you now.
I am giving you a new demand so that you may love each other just as I loved you, that you also may love each other.
In this, all will know that you are students to Me, if you have love among each other."
Simon Peter says to Him, "Master, where are you going back to?" Jesus answered him, "Where I am going back to, you are not able to follow with Me now. You will follow with Me later."
Peter says to Him, "Master, why am I not able to follow with You now? I will put my soul out there on Your behalf."
Jesus answered him, "Will you put your soul out there on My behalf? Amen, amen, I tell you, a rooster will not in any way crow until the time that you will flatly deny Me three times."
